result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph T Kurth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes: Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-----------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.Any prescription medications to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed. 
-----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-----------------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before 07/05/2016 at 8:00 a.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph T Kurth

Defendant Joseph T Kurth in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 03-15-16. Bond Remains. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Joseph T Kurth in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Joseph T Kurth appeared, Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
